Interface CheckerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Checker

    public interface CheckerInterface
    Interface defining all Checker methods and functions some of which are unimplemented and will be implemented as future milestones are reached

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String[] CheckerInPath(Checker Checker, Checker[] Checkers, java.lang.String[][] coordinates, java.lang.String prevCoord)
      This method checks if there is a checker piece in the path of the selected checker piece to be moved.
      java.lang.String[] CheckerInPath2(Checker Checker, Checker[] Checkers, java.lang.String[][] coordinates, java.lang.String prevCoord, java.lang.String com)
      This method is similar to CheckerInPath(), but the difference in this method is that this method discovers which two checkers were previously in the path of the checker before it jumped.
      java.lang.String getColor()
      gets the color value of a piece
      java.lang.String getCoord()
      gets coordinates of a checker piece
      boolean hop(Checker Checker, Checker[] Checkers, java.lang.String[][] coordinates, java.lang.String prevCoord)
      This method allows for a piece to move two spaces instead of one (which is what needs to be done when an opponent piece must be hopped over and overtaken)
      boolean illegalMove(Checker Checker, Checker[] Checkers, java.lang.String[][] Coordinates, java.lang.String prevCoord)
      This function checks if a move is legal.
      boolean illegalPlacement(Checker Checker, Checker[] Checkers, java.lang.String[][] coordinates)
      Checks current checker with other checkers locations to see if current checker is overlapping

      checks if the piece is a king or not

      Checks if there is a checker piece on the currently selected tile.

      This method checks if the piece already has king status.
      boolean Overlap(Checker Checker, Checker[] Checkers, int index)
      Ensures that any pieces which are attempting to be placed do not overlap

    • Method Detail

      • illegalPlacement

        boolean illegalPlacement(Checker Checker,
                         Checker[] Checkers,
                         java.lang.String[][] coordinates)
        Checks current checker with other checkers locations to see if current checker is overlapping
        Parameters:
        Checker - checker piece the user wants to place
        Checkers - array of current checkers on the board
        coordinates - a 2-dimensional array of checkers currently on the board used to compare x and y coordinates
        Returns:
        returns true if a piece is already in the coordinates (illegal move) or if the user attempts to place a piece on a white tile returns false otherwise (the move is legal)

      • hop

        boolean hop(Checker Checker,
            Checker[] Checkers,
            java.lang.String[][] coordinates,
            java.lang.String prevCoord)
        This method allows for a piece to move two spaces instead of one (which is what needs to be done when an opponent piece must be hopped over and overtaken)
        Parameters:
        Checker - checker piece the user wants to place
        Checkers - array of current checkers on the board
        coordinates - a 2-dimensional array of checkers currently on the board used to compare x and y coordinates
        prevCoord - the coordinate that the checker piece that the user wants to move is currently on
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Checker is able to hop over a piece legally, so if there is a piece in front of the selected piece and a legal jump is possible. Otherwise, false is returned.

      • Overlap

        boolean Overlap(Checker Checker,
                Checker[] Checkers,
                int index)
        Ensures that any pieces which are attempting to be placed do not overlap
        Parameters:
        Checker - current piece attempting to be placed
        Checkers - array of checker pieces currently on the board
        index - the possible index of the checker the user is attempting to place
        Returns:
        returns true if the Checker's coordinates match the coordinates of any piece currently on the board (in the Checkers array)

      • illegalMove

        boolean illegalMove(Checker Checker,
                    Checker[] Checkers,
                    java.lang.String[][] Coordinates,
                    java.lang.String prevCoord)
        This function checks if a move is legal. Checks the position of the current checker in relation to the other checkers on the board and if the piece is regular or a king and allows or disallows movement accordingly.
        Parameters:
        Checker - the current checker the user wishes to move
        Checkers - the array of all checker pieces on the board
        Coordinates - a 2-dimensional array of checkers currently on the board used to compare x and y coordinates
        prevCoord - the coordinate that the checker piece that the user wants to move is currently on
        Returns:
        return true if the move is legal, false if the move is illegal

      • CheckerInPath

        java.lang.String[] CheckerInPath(Checker Checker,
                                 Checker[] Checkers,
                                 java.lang.String[][] coordinates,
                                 java.lang.String prevCoord)
        This method checks if there is a checker piece in the path of the selected checker piece to be moved. If there is a checker in the path, return the checker that is in the path and do not allow movement
        Parameters:
        Checker - the current checker the user wishes to move
        Checkers - the array of all checker pieces on the board
        coordinates - a 2-dimensional array of checkers currently on the board used to compare x and y coordinates
        prevCoord - the coordinate that the checker piece that the user wants to move is currently on
        Returns:
        return the location of the checker piece that is in the path of the selected checker

      • CheckerInPath2

        java.lang.String[] CheckerInPath2(Checker Checker,
                                  Checker[] Checkers,
                                  java.lang.String[][] coordinates,
                                  java.lang.String prevCoord,
                                  java.lang.String com)
        This method is similar to CheckerInPath(), but the difference in this method is that this method discovers which two checkers were previously in the path of the checker before it jumped. This method computes which checker should be eliminated.
        Parameters:
        Checker - the current checker the user wishes to move
        Checkers - the array of all checker pieces on the board
        coordinates - a 2-dimensional array of checkers currently on the board used to compare x and y coordinates
        prevCoord - the coordinate that the checker piece that the user wants to move is currently on
        com - used to compare coordinates for selected king pieces
        Returns:
        return the array tl2

      • kingMe

        java.lang.Boolean kingMe(Checker checker,
                         java.lang.String[][] board)
        This method checks if the piece already has king status. If it does not, then the method checks the coordinate data of the piece Checker to see if it has made it to the opposite side of the board and then gives it king status.
        Parameters:
        checker - the current checker the user is attempting to move
        board - the array containing the coordinates of the board
        Returns:
        return true if the piece is on the other side of the board and is not a king, otherwise return false

      • getCoord

        java.lang.String getCoord()
        gets coordinates of a checker piece
        Returns:
        coordinates

      • setCoord

        void setCoord(java.lang.String coord)
        setter for the coordinates of a piece
        Parameters:
        coord - the new coordinates of the piece

      • isKing

        boolean isKing()
        checks if the piece is a king or not
        Returns:
        true if the piece is a king, false if not

      • setKing

        void setKing(boolean king)
        sets a piece to be a king
        Parameters:
        king - sets king if true, does not if false

      • getColor

        java.lang.String getColor()
        gets the color value of a piece
        Returns:
        color

      • setColor

        void setColor(java.lang.String color)
        sets color of checker piece
        Parameters:
        color - either grey or black

      • isSelected

        int isSelected(java.lang.String currentTileSelected,
               Checker[] Checkers)
        Checks if there is a checker piece on the currently selected tile.
        Parameters:
        currentTileSelected - the selected tile
        Checkers - the array of checkers on the board
        Returns:
        1 if selected or 0 if not
